column4: I know ubuntu will auto mount stuff when I login at home using gdm into gnome, and then from the Places menu I click on the drive (e.g. a 320gb usb hdd in this case) then the drive appears mounted under the /media directory.  isn't there an equivalent command to do this from the cli (e.g. remotely over ssh?) so i can access those files?
that requires me to know the device in /dev
you're right you need to know the devicename
i am hoping ubuntu can figure it out and just mount all the drives that normally appear under the Places menu for me
mount -a mounts everything in fstab, and to put the drives in fstab you'd need to know the devicename
